comment: Damaged road which needs to be resurfaced on Alandi Road when we take a turn towards Pratiknagar and Valmiki Udyan please fix this Location indicated on the map . <URL>
amr:
# ::snt Damaged road which needs to be resurfaced on Alandi Road when we take a turn towards Pratiknagar and Valmiki Udyan please fix this Location indicated on the map . <URL>
(f / fix-02
      :mode imperative
      :polite +
      :ARG0 (y / you)
      :ARG1 (r / road
            :ARG1-of (d / damage-01)
            :ARG1-of (r2 / resurface-02
                  :ARG1-of (n / need-01)
                  :location (r3 / road
                        :name (n2 / name
                              :op1 "Alandi"
                              :op2 "Road"))))
      :time (t / turn-01
            :ARG0 (w / we)
            :direction (a / and
                  :op1 (c / city
                        :name (n3 / name
                              :op1 "Pratiknagar"))
                  :op2 (c2 / city
                        :name (n4 / name
                              :op1 "Valleiki"
                              :op2 "Udinyan"))))
      :ARG1-of (ii / indicate-01
            :location (m / map)))

comment: Thank you for sharing your concern . We have taken cognizance of this issue . Your token number is T10500 . You can track your complaint status at : <URL>
amr:
# ::snt Thank you for sharing your concern . We have taken cognizance of this issue . Your token number is T10500 . You can track your complaint status at : <URL>
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (t / thank-01
            :ARG1 (y / you)
            :ARG2 (s / share-01
                  :ARG0 y
                  :ARG1 (c / concern-01
                        :ARG1 y)))
      :snt2 (t2 / take-01
            :ARG0 (w / we)
            :ARG1 (r / realize-01
                  :ARG0 w
                  :ARG1 (ii / issue-02
                        :mod (t3 / this))))
      :snt3 (n / number
            :mod (t4 / token)
            :poss (y2 / you)
            :domain (s2 / string-entity
                  :value "T10500"))
      :snt4 (p / possible-01
            :ARG1 (t5 / track-01
                  :ARG0 (y3 / you)
                  :ARG1 (s3 / status
                        :mod (c2 / complain-01
                              :ARG0 y3))
                  :location (u / url-entity))))

comment: Ticket Closed and no work done . Today's picture attached Please reopen it . By the way , the ticket update is weird . And the Citizen Name is different . Was this ticket number communicated correct ? <URL>
amr:
# ::snt Ticket Closed and no work done . Today's picture attached Please reopen it . By the way , the ticket update is weird . And the Citizen Name is different . Was this ticket number communicated correct ? <URL>
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (a / and
            :op1 (c / close-01
                  :ARG1 (t / ticket))
            :op2 (w / work-01
                  :polarity -))
      :snt2 (a2 / and
            :op1 (r / reopen-01
                  :mode imperative
                  :ARG0 (y / you)
                  :ARG1 (p / picture
                        :time (t2 / today)
                        :ARG1-of (a3 / attach-01)))
            :op2 r
            :mode imperative
            :polite +
            :ARG0 y
            :ARG1 (ii / it))
      :snt3 (a4 / and
            :op1 (w2 / weird
                  :domain (u / update-01
                        :ARG1 (t3 / ticket)))
            :op2 (d / differ-02
                  :ARG1 (n / name
                        :mod (c2 / citizen)))
            :mod (b / by-the-way))
      :snt4 (c3 / correct-02
            :polarity (a5 / amr-unknown)
            :ARG1 (n2 / number
                  :mod (t4 / ticket)
                  :mod (t5 / this))))

comment: Pl reopen the complaint is closed without resolving
amr:

(r / reopen-01
      :mode imperative
      :ARG0 (y / you)
      :ARG1 (c / complain-01
            :ARG1-of (c2 / close-01
                  :ARG1-of (r2 / resolve-01
                        :polarity -
                        :ARG0 y))))

comment: Sir , Please provide the token number for your complaint . Thank you
amr:
# ::snt Sir , Please provide the token number for your complaint . Thank you
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (s / say-01
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (p / provide-01
                  :mode imperative
                  :polite +
                  :ARG0 (s2 / sir)
                  :ARG1 (n / number
                        :mod (t / token))
                  :ARG2 (c / complain-01
                        :ARG0 (y / you)))
            :ARG2 y)
      :snt2 (t2 / thank-01
            :ARG0 ii
            :ARG1 (y2 / you)))

comment: Finally after a couple of follow-ups , the issue is resolved but again work quality is at best average . Why does officials need such follow ups ? They close tickets without resolution , Need multiple follow-ups and at times the issue never gets resolved . <URL>
amr:
# ::snt Finally after a couple of follow-ups , the issue is resolved but again work quality is at best average . Why does officials need such follow ups ? They close tickets without resolution , Need multiple follow-ups and at times the issue never gets resolved . <URL>
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (r / resolve-01
            :ARG1 (ii / issue-02)
            :time (f / final)
            :concession-of (a / average-04
                  :ARG1 (q / quality
                        :mod (w / work-01))
                  :mod (a2 / again)
                  :mod (a3 / at-best)))
      :snt2 (c / cause-01
            :ARG0 (a4 / amr-unknown)
            :ARG1 (n / need-01
                  :ARG0 (o / official)
                  :ARG1 (f2 / follow-up-03
                        :mod (s / such))))
      :snt3 (a5 / and
            :op1 (c2 / close-01
                  :ARG0 (t / they)
                  :ARG1 (t2 / ticket)
                  :manner (r2 / resolve-01
                        :polarity -))
            :op2 (n2 / need-01
                  :ARG0 t
                  :ARG1 (f3 / follow-up-03
                        :quant (m2 / multiple)))
            :op3 (r3 / resolve-01
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG1 ii
                  :time (e / ever)
                  :frequency (a6 / at-times))))
